Reviews.Title: “Not nice!”
Reviews.Author: NicoleAbuDhabi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just stayed there and I would not recommend this hotel to anyone!!! It is old, not that clean, not a good breakfast, extremely rude staff! If you want to go to Istanbul, choose one of the nice small hotels in Sultanahmet. They are much nicer and cheaper. There are multiple reasons why we did not like this hotel: 1. The staff was VERY rude and not helpful. Even though our reservation started on the 15th and we arrived there only early on the 16th, our room was not ready. A very rude lady at the reception told us that the room will be ready only at 12. After I showed her that our reservation started one day ago, she still said she does not have a room ready...Eventually (very annoyed and giving me very evil looks) she gave us a room with 2 single beds...I went back downstairs and asked for a room with one bed (that is what we had reserved...). She literally started yelling at me saying "See your reservation? It says one standard room; it doesn't say how many beds!â€� I was quite shocked of how she can really shout at me.... After discussions, she eventually told us maybe a room with one bed will be ready later.... My husband and I were celebrating one year since our engagement and my birthday so you can imagine this was a horrible way to start our day... 2. The taxis they bring to the hotels only want to rip you off! Here's the story: we wanted to go out in the evening so we asked one of the staff how much a taxi fare would be until the place where we want to get. He said at around 20 TL. Someone else from the staff offered to call a taxi for us. We were waiting outside but the taxi didn't show up so my husband wanted to just stop a taxi on the street. The hotel staff told him "no, please wait, YOUR taxi is coming"... Unfortunately we waited and "our" taxi arrived... The first thing the guy told us is that if he puts the meter on, it will be 65 TL (over 3 times more than what a normal fare is...) and if we agree that he drives without a meter on, it will be 45 TL (still more than twice the normal fare). My husband told him to put the meter on. He drove us around in circles for about one hour... we knew where we had to get and we realized he's driving on the opposite direction...Anyway, after being on the car for one hour, we just got out near a metro station and took the metro... So, what do you think: is it just a coincidence that the hotel insisted that we wait for this particular taxi? 3. Terrible breakfast. It was really not something to look forward to... 4. The walls are very very thin so we could clearly hear our neighbors talking, shouting, using the shower, the toilet..., you could hear EVERYTHING!!!! Even if someone was on the hallway, speaking, you could clearly hear them... 5. The AC was very loud; we just had to leave it off most of the time. 6. We did not have soap in the room at the beginning and we only had one bath towel... 7. The room was very dark, there was a window but it was facing an interior yard, towards the room where the breakfast was... 8. The bed and pillows were very uncomfortable. 9. The hotel is NOT in Sultanahmet, as they claim. It is 5 minutes to the tram station and then 3 tram stations until you get to Sultanahmet. So bottom line, we had a horrible experience there. Please don't choose this hotel. Istanbul is such a great city and it would be a shame to remember such a bad experience...

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: marshfoot
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here on numerous occasions, the Hotel is Ideally situated close to all tourist attractions and within a short taxi ride (Cheap) to taxim Square and Istabul caddessi the main shopping lane. The rooms are somewhat dated but clean and comfortable and a reasonable size for Istanbul Hotels. The rate includes breakfast and the costs are very good. The breakfast is brilliant, so many choices of breads, fresh fruits, drinks, cakes and hams. Staff always helpful and they speak many languages including English.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK.”
Reviews.Author: Journogrrl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice enough, but the rooms are very hot, and the fans/AC are not very effective. Also, there is some kind of bar nearby, and loud cover music blares all night long, meaning you have to sleep with the windows closed and earplugs in. In addition, the bath-shower leaks, so after a shower the floor in the bathroom is sopping wet. On the other hand, the desk staff are very helpful, the breakfast is generous and tasty, and the room is big and spacious. Free wi-fi is available, and not bad, a bit slow, but OK.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth a dime”
Reviews.Author: ehsan-aj
Reviews.Content: The hotel was reserved via tour and at our arrival in 8AM, we knew we have to wait for check in time, but when my friend was heading for restroom, the receptionist didnt let him go upstairs and she thought he wanted to go for breakfast, the behaviour was rude, despite her own misunderstanding... the rooms were tiny and the windows were opened at patio where the restaurant was located, so we could clearly hear every rooms conversations and noises of getting ready for breakfast. The reciptionists did not know English at all and were not mature enough to managethe guests. Breakfast not so interesting... Don't bother to think about this

Reviews.Title: “Serious problems with cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: TroubledAditi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in May 2010. You might find this hotel a suitable option if you intend to do a lot of sightseeing in Sultanahmet and won't spend much time in the hotel room. My room had a nice view to the Suleiman mosque but that could not make up the poor maintenance of the room. It was very dusty and dirty. The cleaning staff didn't change the plastic bag of the bathroom rubbish bin, just took the rubbish out of it. When I decided to change the bag myself I discovered the rubbish bin was so dirty that my hands smelled for a couple of hours afterwards, despite of washing. The hotel has good amenities but they are not free of charge for the customers. Using the tiny pool on the rooftop costs 10 euro. On the ground floor they have a sauna but it would have cost some 30 dollars to use it. This hotel seems to be favoured by Russian tourist groups. They also have Russian satellite channels on TV. I didn't like Sultanahmet area especially much. The vendors on the streets and in the Grand Bazaar are very pushy and everybody was talking to me in Russian (I am not Russian even though I look like it). If you are not very much into the touristy thing stay in Taksim instead of Sultanahmet! Istanbul has very good public transport and a ticket costs only 1,5 lira. You may hop into the metro straight at the AtatÃ¼rk airport. I went to the Asian side (Ãœskudar) twice just because it's fun to ride a ferry across Bosphorus. There are several docks on the both sides where you can catch a ferry.

Reviews.Title: “very poor the picture in hotle site dffrent than real”
Reviews.Author: maherabdul
Reviews.Content: the bath room not clean , a/c very bad you cant controled , is atomaric the is the first time see hotle they control the a/c not you , the below not clean

Reviews.Title: “.Elegant hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: ghalia-alshareef
Reviews.Content: we use to stay there mounthly for more than tow years!! It's really wonderful,we feel ourselves in our home becouse of the kindness of the reception staff there..since we make reservation untill we leave Istanbul they are with us with thier gentleness...Frankly they act the most important rule in the hotel..you can find alot of hotels with testy food , clean room and nice view but-with my respect to all- you cant find polite staff like Grand Gulsoy staff.. thanx for all Mohamed Al-Shareef Family

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maryamjoon
Reviews.Content: I have been there with my husband and two young children last Sept 2009 for 1 week. They gave us a room which was so dark and hot despite Istanbul's pleasant wether, but they gave us an additional fan which helped us to sleep well. Staff (specially receptionists) are not friendly that much but they are respectful. Location is very good and near to shopping centers. Generally it was a good hotel to stay.

Reviews.Title: “so beautiful, so good ... the TOP”
Reviews.Author: belloexplorer
Reviews.Content: I went there with my friends, they are so friendly ... they are trying to give u all u need , very available , so cheap for the services that u have, so TOP , panorama so beautiful of SHEZADE e SULAIMANY mosque , so near to all sevices and trasportations. bellissimo ,stupendo , ci andrei tutte le volte !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “more than worse”
Reviews.Author: baahareh
Reviews.Content: little rooms, dirty bathroom, small bathroom, not comfortABLE, A VERY BAD location,i dont advise you to go there, but if you want to just made shopping for your butique, its ok, because it is near the places which you can buy a bulk of dressses with diffrest sizes,

Reviews.Title: “satisfied”
Reviews.Author: maximiliuse
Reviews.Content: I went to istanbul 2 weeks ago for both buisness and leisure. I didnt expect too much because I read the reviews before and saw the pictures, but I have to be honest it was very good and comfortable hotel with very nice and helpful staff. although the room was small but the bathroom was clean and with a very good shower.Breakfast wasn't suitable for 4 star hotel but I couldn't complain. I enjoy my stay in gulsoy and I think it's worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “The service made me feel at home”
Reviews.Author: amanager
Reviews.Content: The Good: The best thing about my stay at this hotel was the service offered. The reception staff was the most accomodating. They went out of their way to find us alternatives to their suggestions for things like the Turkish bath. One of the reception supervisor even offered for me to use his laptop because I couldn't get Windows Live Messenger to sign in from the guest computer. They let us have the iron board for free (everything in Turkey is chargable). The hotel is walking distance from the tram station and 2 stops away from the Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar, Haggia Sophia. The hotel is also around the corner from te local market which is a worth a visit (turn right when you exit the hotel and walk down the street). A lot of food joints are just outside the hotel. The Bad: I stayed there for 4 nights with my parents and brother and another family of 3 that were with us on the tour and for all 4 mornings we had the same breakfast! Absolutely no change in the menu - scrambled & boiled eggs, sausages, stale cereals, a variety of breads and jams/preservatives, a couple of types of cheese, honey, yogurt and fruits. Another thing that I did not appreciate was their non-usage of the airconditioning system. They would turn it off and it would take a lot of phone calls to the reception to have them turn it back on. And they turn it off again in the middle of the night - I remember having woken up at 3am to make a call to the reception because my room was no less than a furnace. The rooms were slightly smaller than what you'd except from a 4 star hotel, but comfortable nonetheless. Also, the rooms & bathrooms are not sound-proof - you can hear the toilet flushing in the room next door if you're in the bathroom and can hear voices outside your door if people talk loudly. The Ugly: My father asked one of the waiters at the breakfast venue if he could make a sunny-side-up egg and he said it's for an extra 10 USD! My father even offered to make the egg himself if the waiter could just provide him with an egg and he said "no - only what is on the menu".

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: travelling2424
Reviews.Content: I spent a few nights at this great hotel a few weeks ago. it was fantastic!! the service was great, and i got to make great use of the pool and sauna which was very clean and well looked after. the rooms are beautiful, and the service is fantastic. they also have a great disco/bar in the evenings which makes the whole experience even more grand. also got to play some bowling where i met some other friendly people, all thanks to the hotel staff. i'd recommend this hotel to anybody - families, friends, singles, couples etc. the great location also makes it worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “it was fabulous”
Reviews.Author: betzzzy
Reviews.Content: we were there last month as a family and we had such a great time. the service was excellent when we got there. the workers were very helpful. there was a receptionist named koray he introduced the hotel to us at the start. he was very helpfull with what we wanted. you will find anything you need in this hotel. we used to go play blliards or bowling after dinner. we had so much fun in the disco music was good. the pool and sauna is just great for relaxing vacationists. the rooms are very clean and room service is professionaly done.

Reviews.Title: “nice and easy”
Reviews.Author: DSay
Reviews.Content: stayed at this place with a group of friends... 'twas affordable, no dramas, and the reception staff were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Two stays in 2 years”
Reviews.Author: Alexandra_Shaye
Reviews.Content: July 2009 was my second time in Istanbul, and both times I stayed at the Grand Gulsoy Hotel. The staff are absolutely great, always helpful and nice. Whatever I needed, like an arranged trip, or finding a safe taxi, or anything, they were always at the reception, giving me the best service. The room was clean, the sheets and towels being changed every day. I had internet connection in the room (wi-fi). Breakfast was simple but enough for one meal. I had access to both pools, which was great, as I needed to rest after I walked around the city all day. Upstairs terrace and pool are brilliant for sun-bathing as well.If I'll go to Istanbul again (which I plan on doing next summer), I will surely go to the Grang Gulsoy Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Staff & cleanlyness great”
Reviews.Author: Shirley21
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights and although it wasn't really suitable for my husband who is disabled the staff could not have made our stay more comfortable. Our room over looked the mosque which was all lit up at night and looked great. Again it wasn't really suitable for a disabled person as it had a bath but it was very clean and sheets and towels were changed daily. Breakfast was the same every day which let them down but again the staff were clean and helpful. The coffee shop was great. Lovely food and superb cakes!! This more than made up for breakfast. The staff here were the best we met on this trip to turkey. We didn't really use any of the fascilities but went down to the small bowling alley and everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves. Location was great for shopping and getting around. This would not be rated 4* in England but it cannot be faulted for cleanleyness and great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Rough around the edges...”
Reviews.Author: AnnoulaVolos
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this "4 star" hotel for 6 nights. Ask for a outside-room, because the inside-rooms are very small & noisy. Although the sheets were changed every day, twice my bed was made with sheets with holes in them... Breakfast buffet is very simple/basic without French/Filter coffee! Despite of all these things, the rooms were very clean & and the hotel staff very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Central Hotel but not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ellemic
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hotel Gulsoy for total of 5 days and it definitely was not classed as a 4 star hotel as stated by the tour company we joined with. Thedouble room we had was small. The airconditioner was blowing out hot air. This was uncomfortable as we went in April. The bathroom was small and it did not seem to be cleaned. The shower cap was re-used. The shampoo that would have been half empty was filled up with water. The breakfast was pretty standard. Not much to choose from. The orange juice was cordial and the coffee tasted very unusual. In terms on location it was pretty good and was close to the Grand Bazaar. The good thing about the hotel was the free internet service. For me this was not classed as a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worse than I imagined”
Reviews.Author: https
Reviews.Content: In Spain, it wouldnâ€™t be considered a four star hotel. They would be lucky if it were given three stars. The hotel is very old (and old-fashioned), the views are horrible (from our room you can only see a very ugly inner patio) and there is not enough natural light in the room. In the bathroom you find a rusty curtain bar and old stuff. Fortunately, we only used the hotel to sleep, have a shower and have breakfast. Regarding breakfast: Not very good. There is no variety of food or drink and everything seems to be very simple. The pool is completely useless, because it closed at 5 p.m. What time are we supposed to have a bath in Istambul? 7:00 in the morning? I found the staff to be friendly. However, I was told bad stories about them by some of my mates . On the other hand: location is quite good, near Sultanhamet, Grand Bazaar, etc. and maybe you only need the hotel to sleep and have a shower. Tramway station is less than five minutes by foot. I wouldnâ€™t return to Gulsoy if I were able to choose another hotel nearby.
